document.docAuthor: Li, Weichun, Li, Houhun & Nuss, Matthias
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the genus Eudonia Billberg, 1820 from China (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Scopariinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the genus Eudonia Billberg, 1820 from China (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Scopariinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Chinese species of
Eudonia
based on male genitalia

subSubSection.paragraph:
(excluding
E. gigantea Sasaki
whose male is unknown)

paragraph.keyLead:
4 . Uncus with spine on both posterolateral margins (
Fig. 22
).....................................
E. duospinata
sp. n.

5 . Phallus curved near base (
Sasaki 1991 :
Fig. 21
)................................................
E. microdontalis

- Phallus straight near base (
Sasaki 1991 :
Fig. 23
)...................................................
E. persimilis

11 . Valva angled ventrally at two thirds, phallus straight (
Sasaki 1998 : Fig. 35
)...........................
E. taiwanalpina

- Valva arched ventrally at two thirds, phallus curved at middle (
Fig. 18
).......................
E. zhongdianensis
sp. n.

12 . Phallus nearly as long as valva (
Sasaki 1998 :
Fig. 31
).................................................
E. inouei

- Phallus about half length of valva (
Sasaki 1998 :
Fig. 33
).............................................
E. umbrosa

- Gnathos two thirds length of uncus (
Sasaki 1998 :
Fig. 25
)...........................................
E. promiscua

16 . Valva concave ventrally at about two fifths (
Fig. 15
).........................................
E. rectilineata
sp. n.

17 . Juxta with width one third of length (
Nuss 2005 : Fig. 107
)........................................
E. truncicolella

- Juxta with width half as long as length (
Fig. 16
)............................................
E. wolongensis
sp. n.

19 . Valva almost straight ventrally (
Fig. 17
)...................................................
E. lijiangensis
sp. n.

- Valva conspicuously concaved ventrally at middle (
Fig. 20
).....................................
E. hexamera
sp. n.

21 . Valva straight ventrally, phallus curved at middle (
Nuss 2005 : Fig. 81
)................................
E. mercurella

- Valva concave ventrally at one third, phallus nearly straight (
Sasaki 1999 :
Fig. 6
)........................
E. apicifusca

22 . Valva with a ventroapical protuberance (
Nuss 2005 : Fig. 84
).........................................
E. lacustrata

23 . Phallus straight, shorter than valva (
Fig. 24
)........................................................
E. tibetalis

- Phallus slithtly curved, longer than valva (
Fig. 14
)........................................
E. singulannulata
sp. n.
